title: Sec 4 Combined Chemistry - Chapter 12: Reactivity Series (Worksheet 2)
subject: Combined Chemistry
author: Chemistry Department
description: Second worksheet on reactivity series, displacement reactions, and corrosion of iron.

questions.question: Which metal reacts most vigorously with dilute sulfuric acid?
questions.explanation: Magnesium is highest in the reactivity series among these options, so it reacts most vigorously.

questions.question: Which metal will NOT displace hydrogen from dilute hydrochloric acid?
questions.explanation: Copper is below hydrogen in the reactivity series, so it cannot displace hydrogen from acids.

questions.question: What happens when iron is placed in copper sulfate solution?
questions.explanation: Iron is more reactive than copper, so it displaces copper from the solution, forming a copper coating.

questions.question: Which metal reacts with cold water to form a hydroxide and hydrogen gas?
questions.explanation: Sodium reacts vigorously with cold water to form sodium hydroxide and hydrogen gas.

questions.question: What is the correct order of reactivity (most reactive first)?
questions.explanation: Potassium (K) is most reactive, followed by sodium (Na), then calcium (Ca), then magnesium (Mg).

questions.question: Which statement about obtaining metals from their ores is true?
options: Gold is usually found as a pure metal
All metals require electricity to extract
More reactive metals are cheaper to obtain
Iron is always found as a pure element
questions.explanation: Gold is very unreactive and can be found as a pure metal in nature, while more reactive metals are always found combined in ores.

questions.question: What is formed when magnesium reacts with steam?
questions.explanation: Magnesium reacts with steam to form magnesium oxide and hydrogen gas.

questions.question: Which metal will displace silver from silver nitrate solution?
questions.explanation: Copper is more reactive than silver and will displace it from silver nitrate solution.

questions.question: Why does painting prevent rusting?
options: Prevents oxygen and water from reaching iron
questions.explanation: Paint forms a barrier that prevents oxygen and water from coming into contact with the iron surface.

questions.question: Which metal reacts with dilute acid but not with cold water?
questions.explanation: Zinc reacts with dilute acids but does not react with cold water.

questions.question: What happens when copper is placed in iron sulfate solution?
questions.explanation: Copper is less reactive than iron, so it cannot displace iron from its salt solution.

questions.question: Which metal requires the most electricity to obtain from its ore?
questions.explanation: Aluminum is the most reactive among these and requires the most electricity to extract from its ore.

questions.question: What are the products when calcium reacts with water?
questions.explanation: Calcium reacts with water to form calcium hydroxide and hydrogen gas.

questions.question: Which metal is stored under oil to prevent reaction with air?
questions.explanation: Sodium is very reactive and reacts with oxygen and moisture in air, so it's stored under oil.

questions.question: What is observed when a rusty iron nail is placed in dilute acid?
questions.explanation: Rust (iron oxide) reacts with acid to form a soluble salt, so the rust dissolves.
